file_content.text: My lord! My base...! My base is under attack!
The last of my men and I are holed up in the command center. But the doors are about to give!
I'll be right there, Halidrell. Try to hold on.
I'm coming.
Doing the best I can. But I... I got a bad feeling about this. Ahh!
Who is responsible for the attack?
What are you up against?
I don't know. We had no warning! Ahh!
Calm down!
Easy for you to say. You can't see the walls buckling and--ahh!
The command center's been breached! Never seen such power....
Oh no--
Rathari's forces are close to defeating the Republic garrison in the upper industrial sites. There isn't time to waste.
Rathari's also on the verge of taking over the Republic's base of operations in the upper industrial sites.
With his work with the Cartel dashed, he's sure to pour himself into squashing the Republic garrison.
I'll keep banging down doors until I find him.
Persistence, then.
I love a man who's tenacious.
Tenacity is a prerequisite for Sith, I think.
On my way.
If he's not there, you will have failed me twice.
You better be right this time.
Even if Rathari isn't there, when his operations are all thwarted, I know he'll come to you. A confrontation will be inevitable.
More than likely, Rathari's spearheading the charge in the upper industrial sites.
He might want to be there to see the Republic garrison crumble, or to lord it over the Hutts when they cave in to his demands.
Those are excellent leads. Thank you.
Sounds right.
A pleasure, my lord.
Feels like whistling in the wind to me.
A waste of time most likely.
Well, then pucker up and blow. Like I said, make enough noise and he'll come gunning for you.
Word's spread through the streets that Rathari's conference with the Hutts was invaded and his apprentice killed.
Seems like you missed your calling as a diplomat. The Hutts are in a holding pattern to see what comes of your challenge.
No one knows who slaughtered the Hutts, so I'm very impressed. The Empire's alliance is intact.
It's too bad Rathari wasn't in attendance. But man, I bet he's fuming.
If he'd been there, his corpse would be steaming.
I wish he'd been there.
All in good time. He's not the type to duck a fight.
I'm sure our message was heard loud and clear.
Your tip was good.
Your guess proved to be unreliable.
I'm disappointed with you.
I'm sorry about that. Still, I'm sure the message was heard.
With his plans to take out the Republic and occupy their territory lost, all his attention is sure to be on the Hutt Cartel.
It's very likely he's overseeing the treaty agreement with the Hutts this very moment.
He's going to wish he wasn't there.
Too bad for him.
The Hutt Cartel is likely to give in to Rathari's demands any minute. I hope you're in time to stop them.
Halidrell Setsyn. So you're here to take out Lord Rathari. Won't be easy, he usually just appears, devastates then disappears.
You'll have to draw him out. He's been making some major power plays, and disrupting them will get his attention.
You'd better be sure about that.
I value accuracy.
You ruin his business, he's gonna want to chop you into little bitty pieces.
I like the way you think.
Baras trusts me for a reason.
I'll enjoy ruining Rathari's plans.
Can't wait to confront him.
He's going to go nuts, so be ready.
First, Rathari's been strong-arming the Hutt Cartel. From what I hear, they're close to signing over some important territories to him.
He and his apprentice Girik are in conference with the Hutts at Cartel Headquarters. If you burst in....
Rathari would be none too pleased.
I'd get under his skin.
Neither would the Hutts.
I'd be facing a lot of fire power.
It would be a big mess.
Well yeah, if you just went in there lightsaber blazing.
Rathari doesn't sound like the type to negotiate.
He's playing politics?
You're right, he doesn't like talk, but he knows how to apply political pressure.
The Cartel is an Imperial ally. Rathari can't just beat on them, he has to play diplomat. Unfortunately, the same applies for you.
If things turn violent between you and the Hutts, better if there's no one left to identify you.
Don't tell me how to do my job.
Giving me advice is a mistake.
Just trying to cover all the options, my lord. Force of habit working for the Darth.
I'll do my best to keep the peace with our allies.
The Hutts are not my mission.
The other possibility won't carry as many restraints.
I never leave survivors.
Could get hairy. Those oversized slugs have some pretty buff bodyguards.
When all this intrigue is over and Rathari is a memory, maybe we can get to know each other better.
I already warned you, you're barking up the wrong tree.
You're flirting with me again?
Force of habit, my lord. Won't happen again.
Hey, Twi'lek, is he always like this?
No comment.
He's got really high standards.
Hey, soldier, your boss always this much fun?
Yes.
Guess that means I'll celebrate alone.
I've got a shipment of slaves to send out, but I'll be here if you need me. Good luck, my lord.
I know you well enough, I think.
Not interested.
Apologies, my lord. Just thought we might get along.
That will definitely be in order.
Yes.
I look forward to it. I have a feeling you and I will get along real well.
We'll see if I'm in the mood.
Perhaps.
If killing a Sith Lord doesn't make you feel social, not much will.
You have a flair for dramatic entrances. I probably could have handled that, but I'm grateful for your timing.
You're the apprentice Darth Baras prepped me for, yes?
What exactly did he tell you about me?
How much do you know?
He briefed me on your mission here and my part in it.
Baras told me why you're here and how I can help. He neglected to tell me how dashing you are.
Our master's introductions are as thin as his patience.
He is all business.
The Darth is rather stunted when it comes to interpersonal relations.
And Baras failed to tell me what an alluring woman you are.
[Flirt] What an oversight.
Well, well, a Sith with a beating heart.
Focus on the tasks at hand, madam.
Don't bother flirting.
Apologies, my lord. The Darth encourages me to use my feminine wiles.
Correct.
The obvious is my specialty. That's why I keep petitioning the Darth for a raise.
We don't have time for questions. Just do what you've been told.
Skip the pleasantries.
I see you and the Darth are a lot alike--all business.
Sweet talk me all day, darlin', the Exchange is movin' in on this operation of yours. No amount of sugar gonna change that.
Believe me, you're going to prefer the sugar to the spice. Take one step closer, and there will be two dozen Sith surrounding you.
Two dozen? That's a dead giveaway, darlin'. You got none.
One is all she's going to need.
She's not bluffing.
See, not so smug now, are you, Captain?
Excuse the interruption.
These, ahem, gentlemen say they're taking over Darth Baras's slave operations.
So you do got a Sith up your sleeve. Well, we've been trained to take out Sith. Time to flex our muscles.
Muscles don't flex when they've been flayed off the bone.
I'm warning you....
Let's see if you can back up that threat.
I've suffered you long enough.
This is tiresome. [Attack]
Let's talk this over.
Unless you're planning on just killing yourself, I beg to differ.
These are your last breathing moments.
You're about to die.
Now what do you say, big shot?
Ha! We been trained to handle Sith. Kinda glad we get to show off.
Kill the Sith.
You can't walk outside without hearing about Rathari's forces being wiped out and General Kligton killed.
You really rubbed his nose in it by allowing the Republic soldiers to stand victorious.
And it really chafed him that you stole his thunder and took down the Republic garrison yourself.
I hope there's still time. Rathari's meeting with the Hutt Cartel, and his army's advance on Republic operations are close to complete.
